page.title: 18Ecology - Animals
page.content: The animal population around the Misterton area has gradually declined in the last few years.As Farmers strive for larger fields and yields the hedgerows and cover needed by our furry friends as sadly decreased. Although the resilient rabbit seems to be gaining in numbers locally the outlook for others is bleak.The{stoat} and{weasel}are holding firm were they can find cover.The{badger}is no longer seen in this area due to the decline of broad leafed woodland.Regular hunting keeps the local fox population in check but they are occasionally seen, as is the hare.The smaller animals such as mice,voles and shrews are regularly seen but these too must decline as the hedges disappear.{Grass {snakes}are scarce _ adder and common lizard nonexsistent but common just outside the area.
